item.title: Metaphor Re:Fantazio - Official Launch Trailer
item.description: Studio Zero's Metaphor: ReFantazio shows off its characters, combat, and story beats ahead of its upcoming launch on October 11, 2024. The RPG from Persona series director Katsura Hashino will be available on PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X|S, and PC.

item.title: October 11 is a Super Busy Day for Anime Fans
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Major releases on October 11 for anime fans include Dragon Ball Daima and Sparking Zero, the new My Hero Academia movie, and Metaphor: ReFantazio.
  • Dragon Ball Daima will be a throwback to the original series, while Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero is already receiving positive feedback.
  • My Hero Academia: You're Next movie premieres in the US on October 11, with already positive reviews.

Friday, October 11 is an especially busy day for anime fans thanks to new video games, new series, and a movie premiere. Anime and video games have gone hand-in-hand for decades, with all kinds of video games based on anime released over the years, as well as games that take direct inspiration from anime and vice versa.

Typically, big new anime-adjacent releases are spread throughout the year, but there are rare occasions when the stars align and they all release on the same day. October 11 is one such day that anime fans are going to need to keep an eye on, as it is absolutely stuffed with major new releases.

October 11 will see the official launch of fighting game Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero , as well as the debut of the new anime Dragon Ball Daima . That same day, My Hero Academia: You're Next makes its debut in US theaters. On top of all that, Metaphor: ReFantazio , the critically-acclaimed new RPG, is also releasing that day. Clearly, October 11 is going to be an incredibly busy day for anime fans, and they should have absolutely no shortage of things to do this weekend.

Dragon Ball Has a New Series and a New Game Coming Out

Dragon Ball fans especially have a lot to look forward to on October 11. Dragon Ball Daima premieres that day, giving fans the chance to see one last Dragon Ball story that was made with the involvement of legendary creator Akira Toriyama, who tragically passed away earlier this year. For those unfamiliar with the new series, Dragon Ball Daima will see Goku and friends transformed into kid versions of themselves. They then set out on a brand-new adventure that will serve as a throwback of sorts to the original Dragon Ball series as opposed to Dragon Ball Z . It will be great to see Dragon Ball get back to its roots, so fans should be sure to mark their calendars for October 11.

When Dragon Ball fans are done watching Daima , they can turn their attention to Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero . The latest installment in the Budokai Tenkaichi series, Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero features a stacked roster, online multiplayer, an extensive story mode, and more. Early access players have praised just about everything that the game has to offer, and it's likely that its full release will be met with similar fanfare. Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero is already a big hit, and it should only become more popular come October 11.

My Hero Academia: You're Next is Getting Its US Release

Dragon Ball isn't the only anime franchise that will get some time in the spotlight on October 11. That same day, US fans can head to theaters to see My Hero Academia: You're Next , the latest movie based on the mega-popular franchise. Set between the events of My Hero Academia Season 6 and 7, You're Next sees the show's cast of super-powered teenagers do battle with a mysterious enemy who looks like All Might. My Hero Academia: You're Next has already been positively received by fans and critics alike, so US fans should be in for a treat when the new film premieres on October 11.

Metaphor: ReFantazio is Releasing to the Masses

Metaphor: ReFantazio is not based on an existing anime property, but it will still greatly appeal to fans of the medium. The latest RPG from Studios Zero at Atlus, Metaphor: ReFantazio is a medieval fantasy game that features a blend of mechanics from past Atlus games. The game has earned widespread critical acclaim, with Metaphor: ReFantazio standing tall as one of 2024's highest-rated games to date. There's been a great deal of praise for Metaphor 's story, art style, combat system, and the sheer amount of content it has on offer. Metaphor has been called one of the best RPGs in years. Clearly, it will appeal to gamers, but it will also be something that anime fans will want to check out.

Like other games from Atlus, Metaphor 's art style mimics anime. It's basically an anime come to life, giving players the chance to have control over an anime series. The game boasts a cel-shaded art style that allows the developers to keep the anime aesthetic during gameplay, along with anime cutscenes. So, while Metaphor may not be a literal anime, it's still something that anime fans are going to want to set aside time to check out come its release date on October 11.

And this doesn't even take into account the full scope of all the new things anime fans have to look forward to on October 11. For example, the second episode of the Dandadan anime series is airing on October 11, and based on the franchise's reception so far, it certainly has what it takes to be one of the next big things in the space.

item.title: Why a Starfield-Like Fallout Game Isnâ€™t Out of the Realm of Possibility
item.description:
The Fallout games have explored different areas of a post-nuclear America, but each entry has at least revolved around a wasteland one way or another. With each new Fallout game, getting to see what wasteland awaits is a big part of the fun. However, the franchise may be running out of options to continue this franchise trend.

The most recent game in the series, Fallout 76 , focuses on the Appalachian region of the country, which is one of the most unique settings yet. From the New California Republic to the Commonwealth, each setting in Fallout has helped build upon the lore even further. There's no telling when Fallout 5 will come out at this point, but Bethesda will have to present a fresh wasteland that stands out from the others, which is easier said than done. Thankfully, Starfield' s procedural generation could not only help this problem, but it could expand the map beyond what has been attempted before.

The Future of Fallout Embracing a Procedurally Generated Wasteland

Expanding the Scope of Fallout's Reach

Starfield 's procedural generation may not be a perfect way to bring over 1,000 planets to life, but it has a lot of potential if its parameters are made more specific. Although each wasteland in Fallout has had its own unique qualities, there are only so many versions of a wasteland Bethesda can explore before having to recycle them. The franchise has covered nearly every type of landscape found in America. Returning to a similar region is possible, but going even bigger and featuring a procedurally generated version of America that is completely open to explore could be exciting.

Instead of focusing on one central location, the next Fallout could make exploration and aimless wandering a key component in its next game. The only issue is that Bethesda will need to learn from its mistakes with Starfield . At launch, one of the main criticisms of Starfield was that the game's planets felt lifeless and lacked content. Although these planets are likely more lifelike representations of what uninhabited planets could be, getting to travel to earth and see old landmarks would have been thrilling. If Bethesda wants to make the procedural generation truly work, retrying with Fallout and making a point to focus on landmarks and more unique terrain and visuals would be needed.

Despite excitement being reignited by Amazon Prime's Fallout series, Fallout 5 is still years away.

The vastness of Starfield is compelling, and taking this approach with the wastelands of Fallout could be an intriguing step in a new direction. Of course, there would need to be more hand-crafted colonies sprinkled throughout America, but getting to travel between each one could bring the franchise to the next level. The next Fallout is a mystery, but it would be surprising if Bethesda didn't use some of the same tricks as Starfield for its development.

Fallout Showcasing More of the Wasteland

The wastelands of Fallout are just as much of a main character as the Vault Dwellers or the Courier. However, one expansive map that allowed for ultimate exploration could bring an even more epic story to the forefront. If the next Fallout wants to stand out, then there will need to be some big moves made. Fallout 76 did this well with its region and dive into multiplayer, so it will be intriguing to see if Bethesda tries to pivot in a drastic new direction once again.

Fallout 5 may not use procedural generation, but it could need to be at least considered down the road. As of now, Fallout could still explore a wasteland version of the Everglades or deep in the Midwest. There are still options available, but Bethesda may need to go bigger in order to impress audiences.

item.title: All Echoes in Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom (& Where to Find Them)
item.description:
From beds to tables to trampolines to Moblins to Keese to Lynel, there's a boatload of Echoes for Zelda to learn throughout her journey to save Link (and Hyrule) from the treacherous Rifts in Echoes of Wisdom . These Echoes can support Zelda, helping her traverse and also assisting in taking care of the bad guys. If you want to collect all 127 Echoes, this guide will surely help you out.

Down below, we have a table that lists all Echo locations in Echoes of Wisdom . We'll give a brief description of where to find the specific Echo.

The Echoes that have a star (*) by their name dictates that there's a screenshot to go along with the description. Not every Echo needed an image, so we chose to only snag them for the harder-to-find ones.

All Echo Locations in Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

Echoes

Echo Location

*Screenshot of Location

Table Echo

In the prison at the start of the game.

Wooden Box Echo

In the stealth sequence at the start of the game.

Hyrule Castle Pot Echo

In the stealth sequence at the start of the game.

Decorative Shrub Echo

Castle underground after meeting Impa at the start.

Old Bed Echo

Same room as Decorative Shrub.

Boulder Echo

In the Royal-Family shortcut room after escaping jail.

Rock Echo

Suthorn Beach (after getting washed down the river)

Zol Echo

Suthorn Beach (entering out for the first time)

Sea Urchin Echo

Suthorn Beach (spiky enemies everywhere)

Keese Echo

Suthorn Beach (Beach Cave)

Meat Echo

Suthorn Village (In the fireplace of the house by the southern entrance)

Pot Echo

Suthorn Village (in the house left of the Meat Echo home -- by the southern entrance)

Trampoline Echo

Suthorn Village (outside the shop)

Sign Echo

Suthorn Prairie (east of the village exit)

Ignizol Echo

Suthorn Forest (in a cave not far east of the warp point outside the village)

Rope Echo

Suthorn Forest (green snakes hanging out in the grass)

*Caromadillo Echo

Suthorn Forest (inside a cave)

Spear Moblin

Suthorn Forest - You'll find him walking on the main path

*Brazier Echo

Suthorn Forest -outside a cave entrance (place where you find Peahat Echo)

Peahat Echo

Suthorn Forest - inside a cave south of the nearby Waypoint

Strandtula Echo

Suthorn Ruins (2D underground section where Map is found)

Darknut Echo

Suthorn Ruins 2F

Deku Baba Echo

Suthorn Ruins 1F

Clawtula Echo

Suthorn Prairie - northwest of Lueberry's Hut

Octorok Echo

Found in water pools in field north of Suthron Village, Hyrule Field east of the castle

Tangler Echo

Rivers northeast of Suthorn Prairie

Sword Moblin Echo

Rock Field east of Hyrule Castle

Crow Echo

Guay Echo

Tektite Echo

In water near peninsula east of Hyrule Castle

Aruroda Echo

*Caromadillo Level 2 Echo

Gerudo Desert cave

Sand Piranha Echo

Gerudo Desert

ReDead Echo

Gerudo Desert

*Gerudo Pot Echo

Cave in Gerudo Desert

Wind Cannon Echo

Same cave as Gerudo Pot ^

Tornando Echo

Same cave as two above ^ in Gerudo Desert

Wolfos Echo

*Spear Moblin Lv. 2 Echo

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Campaign Rewards Revealed
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Activision has revealed some exclusive rewards players can earn by completing the single-player campaign in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.
  • Rewards include weapon blueprints, an Operator skin, a loading screen, a finishing move, a spray, and several weapon stickers and charms.
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 will be officially released on October 25.

Activision has revealed the multiplayer and Zombies rewards players can get for completing the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 campaign, which includes a plethora of weapon blueprints, an Operator skin, a loading screen, a finishing Move, a spray, and a variety of weapon stickers and charms. Players can also participate in special Campaign Calling Card challenges to unlock various Calling Cards in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , some of which have been kept secret.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is scheduled to be released on October 25, and the game has already shattered some fan's expectations during its beta phase. Activision also recently listed several changes it will be making to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's multiplayer mode based on feedback received from the community during the beta. Now, it seems like the developers have shifted their focus toward building the hype around the game's single-player campaign.

Activision recently gave fans a deep dive into the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 single-player campaign. The first part of this blog was revealed on October 8, when Activision provided an overview of the story leading up to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . One of the most interesting details found in the blog post is that players will receive a variety of multiplayer and Zombies rewards for completing the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 campaign, including blueprints, skins, and more.

All Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Campaign Rewards

  • â€œSlip Sauceâ€ Spray
  • â€œForging Fateâ€ Weapon Vinyl
  • â€œHook, Line, and Sinkerâ€ Finishing Move
  • â€œOnyx Echoâ€ Blueprint (Sniper Rifle: LR 7.62)
  • â€œAllied Effortâ€ Weapon Vinyl
  • â€œHeistâ€ Operator
  • â€œTankâ€ Charm
  • â€œA Good Look at the Devilâ€ Wallpaper
  • â€œThe Cradleâ€ Charm
  • â€œCase Crackerâ€ Blueprint (Melee Weapon: Knife)
  • â€œTruth Serumâ€ Blueprint (Assault Rifle: AMES 85)
  • â€œPocket Acesâ€ Blueprint (SMG: Jackal PDW)
  • â€œThe Bastionâ€ Blueprint (Shotgun: Marine SP)

The blueprints include the "Case Cracker" for the Knife, â€œTruth Serumâ€ for the Ames 85, â€œPocket Acesâ€ for the Jackal PDW, â€œOnyx Echoâ€ for the LR 7.62, and â€œThe Bastionâ€ for the Marine SP. Of these Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 weapon blueprints, fans seem particularly fond of the LR 7.62 sniper rifle blueprint, along with the Ames 85. Players can also unlock the Heist Operator and â€œA Good Look at the Devilâ€ loading screen wallpaper. The â€œHook, Line, and Sinkerâ€ finishing move and â€œSlip Sauceâ€ spray also appear quite appealing to many fans of the franchise.

For players looking to add some bling to their weapons, the â€œTankâ€ and "The Cradle" charms will prove to be an excellent addition. Fans can further customize their weapons with the â€œAllied Effortâ€ and â€œForging Fateâ€ vinyls. There are also additional challenges that players can complete to earn Calling Cards, although the specific details about unlocking them have been kept under wraps. Overall, the rewards are proving to be quite enticing to many fans and make a compelling case for why players will want to dive into Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's single-player campaign mode.
